I had the privilege of climbing all over the OK-GLI Atmospheric Test Prototype. It was remarkably similar to the photos of the "space" version, which I believe flew, once, unmanned.
This surviving, restored Buran proto is in Speyer Technikmuseum, but at the time, some entrepreneurs shipped it to various countries and it ended up in Pyrmont, Sydney, AU for quite a few years in the early 2000s whilst its true ownership was contested. The exhibit was not hugely popular (space-shuttle missions were routine at that time), and so my girlfriend and I were the only ones there on that day, and un-supervised!
Crawling up to the front, I noticed a very Soviet "light green" cockpit along with a pair of Severin K-36 Ejection-seats. They may even have still had the pyros in, knowing the collapse of the old Soviet Union and the "entreprenurial spirit" that overtook the country.
One thing I noticed was the coverings. They were some kind of silicate tiles, but they were "spongy" when pressed. I couldn't get up to feel the leading-edges of the wings, but they were shinier than the US wing LE coverings. The whole thing smelled like a jet, of hydraulic fluid and JP-4.

提交這部影像紀錄片內容持有違反社群組規範紀律條款及違約協議內容包括各類型態廣告商品品質管制服務性系統工程進度營銷經營。造成整個世界性總體性經濟系統工程慘遭重挫虧損品質誠信問題維護相當大的壓力及滅族摧毀新高科技術性機密文件慘遭破壞者擅自引用自主權獨立隱瞞真相虛實誤導消費者權益受損極大爭議事件不間斷過。禍害國民健康醫療飲食均衡發展。失職的縱容過渡民主化，導致許多民眾可以欲所欲為在參政言論執政出席活動期間有所禍害社群滅族跡象顯示出罪嫌移送法辦的機率大於無心關注科學性技術性文件軟體是重要性的主體角色疏忽照顧濫用職權娛樂產生變化飽和狀態中的各種不同的機密文件記憶體模組垂危滅跡所有資源產業虧損嚴重災情難以援交運作監控系統工程進度掌控的危及問題。缺失的直播有待進一步指出廢除的模式考量因素。急速處分莫延誤回覆協商會議。主導權堅定立場無心妥協下後果將會自行負責理賠高科技技術開發案合作夥伴協議約定條款關係企業集團旗下公司的所有虧損負債釐清責任。因此個人意見絕不再與直播節目有所合作夥伴關係義務教育服務性執政維護的此項工作

In the planned next evolution of the Energya rocket (Energya was supposed to be a whole family of heavy and super-heavy rockets), the boosters were supposed to fly back and land using deployable wings. After separating from the rocket, they would open their folded wings, and glide to a landing strip. A similar technology has been used in the Baikal reusable flyback booster, proposed for the Angara rocket family.

2:01:43 They don't listen since someone recently created a piece of music and had it claimed for no reason. YouTube doesn't care if its unfairly claimed, since if deny(Can't remember the function's name.) the claim and say it's fair use, its up to the claimer, not YouTube to decide whether or not its fair use, and 80% of the time they say that it is not fair use, while it is.

If this happens, you should warn the claimer of possible legal actions for fraud, since they are stealing your revenue, which counts as fraud. If this ever happens on something that you should have earned a lot on, say for example a video with a lot of ads and you get claimed for no reason, you could perhaps take legal action.

Taking legal action is one fake claim and a large leap for fair use.
This here will actually support the creators since that means there are less fake claims to deal with - and if you send in a dispute? I think that is the name that I forgot from earlier, and they deny it you'll end up with a strike and the video affected will be taken down. IF this happens THREE TIMES, YOUR CHANNEL WILL BE TERMINATED. First strike: You lose availability to make custom thumbnails and live streaming, I think. I'm sure about the thumbnails, but not so sure about the streaming. IF your channel gets terminated because of this, contact YouTube. If they don't reinstate your channel after a termination, (Which is possible, seen by a massive click baiter having been terminated his channel twice, and yet got it reinstated both times. hint: his name is sernandoe. ) they are technically not enforcing Fair Use, which on a legal side doesn't look good.

But while the goods may look tempting, there are also bads, which includes:
- The prices of legal action (You probably will win the case and will get compensated but if you don't you have to compensate your opponent.)
- YouTube possibly not cooperating properly, and ignoring your requests by making up how they 'cant bring back/reinstate terminated channels'(which is a lie, read a couple of lines above.)
- The possibility of having insufficient time enough to produce content during and due to the case.

All in all, it the goods doesn't outweigh the bad, and neither does the bad outweigh the good.

But seriously, if somebody claims your video that is fair use - don't be silenced by the copyright system, since they are breaking the law. YouTube really needs to fix their copyright systems.

BEWARE! I am not an attorney, a judge or an advocate (Isn't an advocate and an attorney the same?) so I may be inaccurate since I have not gone to law school, yet I do know quite a bit about the algorithm.

Also, just a recommendation: Build your own rocket! Seriously, you can find engines made by Estes on Amazon, for a small price when you think about it.
Love your content, also please begin producing flight suits - like not the one you wear, but like the blue ones by NASA, just make it orange and put the patch you already are selling on it - or sell it seperately, I don't know!
